title: Can't beat the view, food was well done
text: Easy to get to and with the caldera view this was a good vantage point for an afternoon or sunset view. Food was classical and well done

title: Good location, rooms pool and bar area
text: Stayed 3 days in a 2 bedroom suite which is good for two couples, and has a small sitting room with TV. The surprise here was that on the other side of the church is a small town square with several cafes, one of which did a roasted lamb, it was great even if you are not a lamb fan, not done every night. Also this area has a market down the street and is away from the CHAOS of the two towns-which you have to experience, they supply a shuttle service to Thiera. Car is helpful to go to other parts of island
place: Vedema, a Luxury Collection Resort, Santorini

title: Late night in town
text: Stopped in for a couple late night eats and drinks, view of harbor at night and out towards the town

title: Different side of Mykonos
text: Sea lapping up to buildings, sleepy little area, story of the homes is interesting, road into the area can be tight

title: Lots of ruins
text: An area with many ruins, some still intact over a quite wide area, we had a guided 1 and 1/2 hour tour which covered maybe 1/3 of the area. Getting their in rough seas can challenge some, a windy day will create it
place: DELOS, the island of god Apollo

title: Modern or Classical Greek food
text: Rated this way because it was modern Greek food, which is a new twist but leaves out classical dishes-so for a tourist looking for classical food this is not the place. It is well done and has some items not found otherwise

title: Ruins, Food, Shops
text: Below the Acropolis, some ruins in the area, many restaurants, didn't have a bad experience at any we picked and shops with many items-NEGOTIABLE PRICES

title: Got to do it
text: Not much to say here, this is a must see, be careful as some areas are very slippery-DO NOT PICK UP ANYTHING

title: Great Hotel
text: Rooms were well done and bed comfortable, staff friendly and helpful. Into Lobby and the bar made for a good place to stop before leaving the hotel or returning to room. Top floor was still being worked on but had view of Acropolis

title: No problems
text: Had a 11:30 hour flight, one way Business the other Premium Economy. Business much easier on the body but food choices were, eh. Crew did a good job, interestingly because I am over 6 foot the PE seats bathrooms were much better because of interior height (middle of cabin).

title: Weather created chaos in DFW
text: Got into Dallas late due to weather, missed connection because of hail experienced at airport, needed to check 45 planes at the terminal, we waited 1 and one half hours on runway, then missed flight by 20 minutes. Proceeded to go to four gates as each hour or two the flight we were on standby moved, always listed on arrival/departure screen as VIRT, no one in AA had any idea what that meant. It was a frustrating 10 hours as no one could tell us what or if the flight would go. But we escaped DFW!! Had we not, the next flight to get a booking was 3 days out!!!

title: Deliver first rate experience
text: Have been coming here since it opened, the property is now 20 years old, but is kept in good condition. Food buffets have many choices and are reasonable in price. The DJ's that entertain in the pool area-Ricardo, Luis, Giovanni and Christ keep the beat and games going. Watched the NCAA final 4 at the sports bar, Good for families as well as couples, who can use this as a base. Market has most food and beverages needed.
place: The Royal Sands All Suites Resort & Spa

title: to and from airport-no problem
text: Use them for the airport transfer, have always performed efficiently, need to get through the numerous timeshare and other vendors in the airport as Thomasmore is outside

title: They do it right
text:
Have been to Harry's several times over the years, this time did not disappoint as the weather, table location and food all came together. David and Rueben our servers were outstanding, available and timely but not too obvious. Ceasar salad was done table side and then cut into easy to eat pieces. A couple of filets and a ribeye were all done as asked and smooth. Can have choice of three countries beef should you want to compare.
sweet corn side and spinach were excellent accompaniments, ended with chocolate martinis-took the taxi home.

title: Seafood Choices
text: Our experience at the restaurant was excellent, service was attentive, location scenic ocean and food-well one was the crayfish quinoa, not a big quinoa fan but the combo here was outstanding, and the seafood mixed plate was well presented and tasty

title: Unexpected in the entrance to Machu Piccu
text: This is across the river and a jump off point to go to Urubamba ruins and then on to Machu Piccu. Rooms were comfortable, drinks and food options avaiable, but it allowed the adjustment to altitude and was two hours closer to the train

title: Worth the time
text: Enjoyed the service and food selections. Had an interesting presentation of corn soup, with corn three ways and cubes of shrimp, also the steak special and Andean potatoes. Prices were reasonable

title: See the city from three routes
text: This is a good place to start as it takes one to all the areas of the city and allows on and off opportunities. Summer time July and August be will be crowded and if the heat is up during the day the top looks nice but is sweltering. Best time to go is probably after 3pm as the sun is less intense if you want on top. Runs till 8pm

title: Impressive structure
text: Walked to the site from hotel, maybe 1.5 km, hard to miss from a distance and impressive up close. Work ongoing on this but doesn't impact the site. Did not go inside so can't say if worth it or not

title: A bit of a drive but was worth it
text: Went there for dinner, had a very good experience. Started with a hummus dish and sushimi, prepared with seaweed salad (first time have been able to eat this and enjoy it). Several had steaks and one seabass and one combo (included a meat, quail, lamb and pork tenderloin), all done well (chef owner came out to see how things were). Pascal was our server, young but did well in all phases, thought his wine suggestions and opening both beyond his years. Down on the coast so nice views during daytime and on the bottom floor of a hotel. Do offer a three course meal which changes depending on product availability.

title: Golf on the island
text: Played the west course, slope is 136, so although it looks relatively easy, lined by trees and sand it can be difficult. Course and greens in good shape, not great but for a round during holiday it was nice. Played with several very part time players who needed several extra balls to complete the round. Some wildlife on course, nothing to worry about

title: Excellent fish dishes and presetation
text: Service was outstanding, two of the dishes were fish, a sea bass covered in salt, cleaned and fileted at the table. More was the second dish, a sole cooked with a lemon based sauce, expertly fileted at the table. Dessert was a chef made Mango sorbet.

title: As good as being there
text: went with 6 people, mixed empanadas, small salad bar, 3 types of bread, 4 meat dishes all done as asked and quality beef. wine list had all cost levels and price was reasonable for six with two bottles of wine, service was very good.

title: Hall of Fame is worth the time
text: Spent 4 hours in the building and although I am not much of a country fan, this was a very informative and entertaining activity. From temporary exhibits about different stars to old movie clips and a historical movie that spanned a number of decades and encompassed many well known and hardly known talents, it is truly one of the reasons to head to Nashville
place: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum

title: Wild and Crazy
text: To experience the Honky Tonk bars and high energy levels that are part of the Nashville scene, you must take in several of the bars on or near Broadway. It will be a shoulder to shoulder music fed afternoon or evening, come ready to dance, drink or people watch, as all are available. Be prepared to be jostled a bit, but this is part of the experience.

title: Italian charm in San Diego
text: This is like going to Italy, a smallish area, reservations would help, with atmosphere and vibe like a cafe on the continent. Food is authentic and reasonably priced, service was excellent-do not remember our server's name but she was Brazilian and was pleasant, efficient not overwhelming. Manager or owner was around also. We had several dishes but the lasagna seemed to be the winner, enjoyed their version of minestrone soup too

title: Texas type food
text:
Had dinner at the Grill with a 14 yo, 90 yo and two in between. Found good options for all
The crab cakes were great, but tyhe version of shrimp and grits were one of the best! Our server Emil did a great job!

title: Steak Dinner
text: The steak was excellent, the wine choices good, Robert our server very informed on all facets of the menu. Added the lima bean hash, enjoyed it and was the first time I had seen it anywhere

title: Mom's favorite
text: Lunch has plenty of options, a seasonal one was the vegetable soup, which had no pasta but plenty of vegetables! Mom always goes for the french onion soup and the chicken La Madeleleine was very good.

title: Steak place with Argentinian flair
text: Smallish in size, reservations would be best. Number of steak cuts to choose from. Several of us had the multiple filet dish ( made for two). It included a filet from Argentina, Uruguay, Brazil and Netherlands.

title: Cozy restaurant with canal views
text: Although the selection size is small, the dishes are excellent. On the bottom floor you can get canal views

title: A lot to take in
text: Although very crowded (on a Sat), there is ample opportunity to see many artist's work. Need to carve out 3-5 hours to walk through most of the exhibits

title: Escape from the city, in the city
text: Area much like central park but much smaller, there are concerts on certain days of the week and just a relaxed atmosphere

title: Alax's home field
text:
Went to a league game at the arena, they won, but the organization and order were quite different from American football
good option to experience a european soccer (football) game

title: Maginot Line Tour
text: For history buffs and WWII interests this is well worth the time and effort. It is a hour and a half drive through the countryside from the city. The tour of the line goes to 100 feet underground and explains the history of the line and more importantly how the troops lived under for 3 months at a time. Our local guide had some interesting comments on how his family had endured after the Nazi occupation. Our tour was through a river cruise so you will have to do some investigating although you could drive to the site

title: Thingas to do even if you do not board or ski
text: Brought 4 20 somethings to board on a w/e. Rentals did take an hour to complete. Also went on a weekday, everything much smoother. Aside from that the shops and entertainment around the ice rink were able to keep the people not on the slops occupied for the afternoon.

title: Best soup
text:
Stopped in by chance for a mid day snack Had a soup and beer. THe minestrone soup
was the best ever, no pasta filler, all vegetables. Liked it so much took 6 back the next day, had to do the soup again. Also our server suggested other items and steered us away from ones that were not considered as good. Outside the lake view is spectacular

title: Great
text: Had a spinach salad, one enough for two, the Kauai shrimp, good size and did not finish, macadamia nut chicken with mash potatoes and veggies, sauce was great and lemon made it a bit different. Had a sampler for either Mai Tai, pina colada, daq and another type-you pick one and get four sampler flavors.

title: better than a planaterium
text: as clear a star map in the sky as you can see on Earth. At the ranger station the show starts a bit after sunset and explores the sky-for free!- telescopes set up to view celestials bodies, explanation of the night sky. It will be crowded, but patience is rewarded.

title: Black Sand beach, snorkeling from shore
text: This is close to Hilo, has shore access for snorkeling and a lifeguard presence. Many multicolored fish within 100 yards of shore. Beach isn't very large, so plan a long day in sand, there are benches for eating and some sitting benches. Clear day reveals Mauna Kea over the bay

title: Valentine's Dinner
text: Luckily made reservations for the night, special menu available, but had the full slab of ribs with loaded potatoes and veggies-plenty of food. service was excellent in spite of a very busy night, Adequate wine list, but opted for Mai Tai special

title: Don't see this every day
text: Lava waterfalling into the sea from 15 feet is quite a sight, walking on new beachfront land (lava rock) turning around and realizing that the old beach id 400 yards away-really! Walking by the areas that were by passed by the lava flows-whose lucky! Going up to 4000 feet and seeing the steam vents and learning about different type volcanoes-educational, staring into the cauldera at night-glad its well below

title: unusual place to play golf
text: Saw the course on the way to the winery, looked good and played the next day. Great views of both bigger volcanoes, course in good shape, greens a bit ragged but overall a good experience with nature all around

title: Over view of Portugese wines and dinner
text: Wanted to check it out and it was worth it. We did have reservations early 7pm, so had the chance to talk with Ricardo and Ivo about the various wines of Portugal. They have tasters 2-3 oz and glasses or bottles. Try several and determine what you might like more of. I was not familiar with wines from this area and it helped a lot. If you like wine and good food a great choice. Will get busy later so expect that.

title: BDAY CELEBRATION
text: There for a bday but also for restaurant week, fixed menu had good choices Filet, sea bass..Got oysters as a appetizer, small for price. Clam chowder and sweet corn soups, worth every penny. Liked Sam's mash and the green beans with heirloom tomatoes, main courses all good. They have a good selection of wines, too. Had the flourless chocolate cake for dessert, smooth as silk.

title: A bit of history to see
text: The city has feeling for past times. Shops, taverns a shortish walk in history. Several restaurants with local dishes and a unique Sour Cherry liquour drink

title: Hole in the wall that has some food magic
text: This was a great find. Hard to find without local direction. Service, food and atmosphere were a local standout. It really is worth the effort, but popular during the season so plan on waiting a bit. Had ravioli, normally served with oil and butter, asked for red sauce and chef agreed (great). Everyone else in the party's food was also well done. Tried all desserts for that day, best was graham cracker ice cream and vanilla ice cream with lemon curd. If you get tiramisu eat slowly, too fast and the powered sugar will make you cough. Service was outstanding!

title: world heritage site
text: If you want to go into the cloisters area get a ticket before arriving lines can be long, this is a "regular " church that can be closed to tourists, check to be sure it is open

title: quick site to see
text: Interesting to understand how it was built and when built, old fort so inside not much to see and can have a long line to enter

title: Very full
text: The best way to see the old town but completely full much of the time, not an easy area to navigate so it is the best way to get around in that area

title: next best to the Redeemer
text: Great views of the city from across the river. small park around the statue, interesting story of how it came to be. Elevator to top can have long lines, but worth the effort

title: Enjoyed service and food
text: Flo was an enjoyable experience with meals of fish, beef and other. Good atmosphere and service, was not crowded at 9pm

title: 6 hr tour of top sights
text: First time with tours by locals, this was excellent and informative. Paulo Coelho was our guide with five adults. He did an excellent job taking us to several areas and his personal narrative and reflections on Portugese society was well beyond what group or self tours could relate. We were lucky to start when we did, particularly the Cristo re statue (9am) and missed much traffic. He also is a certified tour guide which helps at certain locatons.

title: A slimmed down Merriman's
text: This is part of the Merriman's group, with a bit less cost. We had the Mai tai which was way better and a bit different than others. The menu selections were varied and the Mufungo fish was very well done. Service was also excellent.

title: Good for the family
text: Ate there after the flight from the mainland. Had 7 including two kids 3&4. Burgers were good and service very good. Price was family friendly

title: great course, not for the faint of heart
text: This is a great layout, up and down, primarily through the jungles of the mountainside. It is not easy but the views and layout are good even for the less skilled one time.

title: Enjoyed the the course and Norris our caddy
text: This is a good course that can be enjoyed by many levels of player. A caddy is required and we were lucky to get Norris who helped us navigate the course and gave the less experienced player of our pair numerous suggestions-he didn't charge for the lessons.

title: A unique experience
text: Worth a trip the challenge the hike up the falls. It is much easier than it was a number of years ago, but you still get an adrenaline thrill and the success of making it to the top

title: Well maintained resort hotel, couple, couples or family
text: We had two adult couples, the two bedroom has a master and a "lock off with two double beds. There is a full kitchen with accessories (utensils,etc) and in the living area two Murphy beds which we have used when kids were in tow in the past. There is a market that is 10-15% higher than larger grocery stores, a sports bar that we watched the final four games in a crowd of fans and a reasonable rest that has a buffet , with daily themes (Thursday was Prime Rib). Nice pool and beach area and concierge and a TRAVEL COMPANY ON SIGHT. You can stay there the whole time, do some trips or ride the bus back and forth. The staff is friendly and helpful, it is a vacation club destination so you will be invited to a personal presentation, which you can decline.
place: The Royal Sands All Suites Resort & Spa
